title: Crust Bikes Derecho In Stock Today
content:
We previewed the forthcoming Crust Bikes and Anton Krupicka Derecho model back in November of last year, and Crust Bikes just took delivery of its frameset order. Let’s check out more below…

Derecho Quick Hits

  • Handmade in Taiwan using Reynolds 853 Tubing
  • Three sizes for now: Medium, Large, X-Large
  • Paragon Rocker Dropouts
  • Tig Welded
  • Colors- Pale Yellow | Forest Green
  • Sizes- Medium 56cm | Large 58cm | Extra Large 60cm
  • Head Tube Diameter- 1 1/8″ (Threadless Steerer)
  • Bottom Bracket- 68mm English (BSA) Threaded
  • Steerer Tube Length- 400mm
  • Fork Spacing- 12x100mm
  • Rear End Spacing- 12x142mm
  • Front Axle Thread Pitch & Length- 1.5x124mm
  • Rear Axle Thread Pitch & Length- 1.5x166mm
  • Seat Post Diameter- 27.2mm
  • Weight (Large 58cm)- Frame- 2.52kg or 5lbs 9oz | Fork- 1.4kg or 3lbs 1oz

This non-boost-spaced flat-bar gravel bike takes a whopping 2.6″ 29er tire and features 853 tubing with a beefed-up downtube to endure the rigors of double-track touring and riding. Anton wanted a bike that still rode well when it didn’t have bags strapped to it. Crust Bikes just took in a shipment of Derecho framesets, which come in two colors: tan and green. Its standout feature is the segmented fork, inspired by the Yo Eddy! and it features a matching segmented seat stay.

See more at Crust Bikes.
